drupalNodeEvent.title: Learning from Past Pandemic Governance: Early Response and Public-Private Partnerships in Testing of Covid-19 in South Korea

field_speakers.processed: June Park (George Washington University/National Research Foundation of Korea), William Grimes (Boston University)

field_organizers.processed: BU Center for the Study of Asia, Pardee School of Global Studies

field_description.processed: In this moderated evening talk, Dr. Park presents findings from her latest publication with Eunbin Chung (Univ of Utah) in the special issue on ‘Pandemics, COVID-19, Sustainability and Development’ in the journal World Development. They present a theoretical framework of policy implementation that combines collaboration between public and private sectors (“Public-Private Partnership,” or PPP) to efficiently deal with urgent crises such as COVID-19. The authors explain the role of new institutions prompted by policy failure precedence (Time 1: Middle East Respiratory Syndrome in 2015) that at a later time period (Time 2: COVID-19 in 2020) allow for the activation of PPPs with the aim to extend the political life of incumbent leaderships.
